assistant: The research paper discusses the use of hand gestures to improve artistic creativity. It uses Python and SQL for the development of the project. The project aims to create a virtual painting application using OpenCV and Python, leveraging camera-based hand tracking. The system can be in selection mode or drawing mode, and it allows users to create artistic pieces by choosing colors and shapes via hand tracking. The paper also discusses the future scope of the project, including more sophisticated ways of gesture recognition and the integration of voice recognition systems.

user: what personal projects he has done
assistant:
Vedant has worked on several personal projects, including:

1. LLM Evaluation and Testing Platform: He developed a tool for concurrent evaluation of multiple language models with a single prompt and streaming outputs. He built evaluation features enabling users to assess prompt responses using custom evaluation metrics and GPT-4-based evaluation, leveraging OpenAI's GPT-4 model for high-quality feedback.

2. Virtual Painting Application: He created a virtual painting application using OpenCV and Python, leveraging camera-based hand tracking. He implemented an intuitive interface with selectable colors and shapes via hand tracking.

3. Hand Sign Language Recognition: He created a custom dataset which is available on Kaggle and built custom models using MobileNet with additional layers. He designed an interactive dashboard for language selection and hand sign tracking with real-time feedback.

4. Gujarati POS Tagging: He utilized custom libraries like NLTK for English and Hindi. He created a dataset for Gujarati available on Kaggle, sourced from internet and handwritten texts. He implemented a module that auto-detects the language of the input and provides POS tags.
